# playsHapticsOnly

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the engine ignores audio events.

## Declaration

```swift
var playsHapticsOnly: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Setting this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] causes the engine to ignore all audio events, such as [doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentation/CoreHaptics/CHHapticEvent/EventType/audioContinuous] and [doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentation/CoreHaptics/CHHapticEvent/EventType/audioCustom]. This also reduces latency of starting haptic playback.



## Modifying Playback Properties

- **playsAudioOnly**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the engine ignores haptic events and plays audio events only.
- **isMutedForAudio**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the engine mutes audio.
- **isMutedForHaptics**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the engine mutes haptics.
